context.p: On the Define for subscription page, you can define or update the price model for a specific subscription of a selected customer.

You have selected a subscription to a service that is charged for using the platform's native billing system. This means that you are responsible for defining whether and how much the customer is charged for using the selected subscription.
To define or update a subscription price model:

step.cmd: Check which cost calculation option is valid for the selected subscription:

ul.li: Free of charge: The service is free of charge.
Pro rata calculation: The costs are calculated based on the exact usage of the service in milliseconds.
Per time unit calculation: The costs are calculated for complete time units, for example, whole days or weeks. The time unit is defined under Charges based on.

info.p: If the subscription is free of charge, proceed with Step 6, else with Step 2.

step.cmd: In the Description field, enter a detailed description of the price model. It may, for example, provide details of each element the price model consists of.

info.p: The description is displayed to the customer on a marketplace when he requests details of the service from the service catalog.
You can specify the description in additional languages later by localizing the price model.
info.note: Make sure to use only the controls provided in the editor for formatting your text. Manually entered HTML tags and references to external style sheets or content may result in errors in the page layout.

step.cmd: To provide the price model's description in another language, click Localize.

taskbody.result: The price model changes for the subscription take effect immediately.
